text:
Biden should never have halted construction of the border wall and even he has to admit it now. With more than 232,900 encounters at the Southern Border in the last month alone, Biden's open border policies have failed and caused irreparable harm.
foxnews.com/politics/myorkas‚Ä¶

As I told @PeteMundo, I'm focused on addressing the concerns of Kansans. We'll elect a new Speaker and keep moving on our conservative priorities ‚Äì getting our more than $33 trillion in debt under control, securing our border and providing relief from inflation and high prices.

Today's vote hurts conservatives' ability to achieve the policy wins Americans sent us to Washington to secure. I look forward to resolving this internal personality dispute and getting back to the important business of governing.

estes.house.gov/news/documen‚Ä¶
My resolve is even stronger to return to regular order by passing individual appropriations bills that won't weaken our economy and burden generations of Americans.
But in the event that there is a lapse in appropriations tomorrow at midnight, I've asked that my pay, which is constitutionally mandated, be withheld until the government is fully funded.
Washington borrows about $47,000 every second, or around $28.5 billion per week, and so I've been working to reduce federal spending and restore regular order in the House of Representatives.

HSAs put patients in control of their health care ‚Äì I spoke in support of @WaysandMeansGOP bills that expand access to this critical tool by giving access to currently ineligible Americans, covering direct primary care services and increasing the max contribution limit.
With more than $33,000,000,000,000 in debt, D.C. has to rein in its reckless spending ‚Äì we can't continue to borrow 20% of what we spend without starting to make changes.

Today, @WaysandMeansGOP released even more information from IRS whistleblowers connecting Joe Biden to Hunter's business transactions and exposing an unequal application of the law. All Americans should be viewed the same in the eyes of the justice system. waysandmeans.house.gov/bombs‚Ä¶

The bipartisan Lesser Prairie-Chicken CRA would've allowed Kansas ranchers, farmers and energy producers to do their jobs while continuing local conservation efforts. Instead, President Biden vetoed the will of the people in another display of gross federal government overreach.

Yellen: "My expectation is that they'll stabilize but we'll just keep an eye on it."  

This from the person who thought inflation was transitory. I've introduced and cosponsored legislation that would ease gas prices and refill the SPR. "Keeping an eye on it" won't cut it. (3/3)

Yellen: "They're still down $1.20 off their highs last summer."  

They're also up more than $1.40 from when Biden took office. (2/3)

üßµYellen: "The president wants to make sure that gas prices remain affordable for Americans."  

News flash: at $3.60+ in Kansas, they aren't affordable right now. (1/3)

U.S. service academies offer incredible opportunities ‚Äì just ask our district's own Brady Weathers who is a junior at ‚Å¶@WestPoint_USMA‚Å©, "It's hard, but it's worth it." To learn more or apply by the Oct. 1 deadline visit, estes.house.gov/constituent-‚Ä¶.

Biden's border crisis is also fast-tracking our spending crisis. Medicaid spending on ‚Äúemergency services for undocumented aliens‚Äù exceeded $7 billion in the last year alone ‚Äì just a fraction of the billions of dollars being spent because of Biden's open borders.

My American Innovation and R&D Competitiveness Act now has more than 150 bipartisan cosponsors, demonstrating the overwhelming need innovators throughout the country have for immediate R&D expensing.
estes.house.gov/news/documen‚Ä¶

.@housebudgetGOP's proposal shows it's possible to craft a budget that preserves essential services, like Medicare and Social Security, while balancing our budget. It's irresponsible to continue to borrow $1 out of every $5 we spend ‚Äì our proposal offers a strong course correct.

Kansans are still suffering because bureaucrats in the swamp have distorted Congressional intent in implementing the No Surprises Act. At today's @WaysandMeansGOP hearing, I called on @CMSGov  to correct course and put patients first.

Yesterday as I was at @FlyICT in Wichita I ran into a group of @HonorFlightNet vets heading to our nation's capital. Whether greeting them in Wichita or visiting with them at a monument in D.C., I always enjoy seeing our veterans participating in this great program.

The United States borrows one out of every five dollars it spends. Our spending trajectory is simply unsustainable. It's critical that we slow the growth of spending. We can't fix this problem overnight, but we have to start now.

I recently met with New York Life agents and leadership in Wichita ‚Äì several of whom are recent transplants and love it here. We talked about protections for Social Security, needed fiscal responsibility in D.C., critical tax provisions for Kansans and tools for saving.

It was a great afternoon in Wichita for Open Streets ICT! I enjoyed meandering on Douglas Ave., talking with Kansans and helping the Kansas Food Bank fill bags of apples donated by Dillons. It was a great reminder of the strong community we have here in Wichita.

The Constitution of the United States is the longest-surviving written charter of government in the world. On this Constitution Day, I hope all Americans recognize the duty they have to help carry and preserve this banner of freedom.

It was fun to visit Sedgwick County's @ExplorationKS and see families exploring the museum and enjoying the new bridge flooring that follows the Arkansas River through town. The museum's recent improvements will help advance interest in STEM and aviation.
It's critical that this generation understands and appreciates this country's foundations, and I'm grateful to their teachers for providing them this opportunity and instruction. (3/3)
While it was enjoyable to read portions on the federal courthouse steps in Wichita, I was most impressed with the elementary students‚Äô attention and delivery. (2/3)
üßµAhead of Constitution Day, I joined federal judges, staff and students to read this critical document that lays the foundation for our constitutional republic. (1/3)

@AIAspeaks and the House Aerospace Caucus hosted a reception celebrating National Aerospace Week, where I shared what we're doing to support American aerospace and to praise the many men and women in Kansas and across the country who help the industry take flight.

Today @FriendsU in Wichita celebrated their 125th anniversary. I submitted remarks for the Congressional Record congratulating them on more than a century of excellence in education. Read them here: estes.house.gov/news/documen‚Ä¶

The House Aerospace Caucus served as an honorary co-host for a briefing with @AIAspeaks to discuss how the tax code can be used to spur innovation and support small businesses. Thanks to our panelists @AndrewsAero @aerospacewired @AcutecAerospace @WhoDreamsWins and GSE Dynamics.

Great to start the day with the @KansasChamber ‚Äì more than 70 members are in our nation's capital this week and I was happy to share updates on what is happening in Congress and how it affects Kansas.

The Heart Valve Clinic at Ascension Via Christi St. Francis is just one of five locations globally to test certain heart valve procedures. I'm impressed with their advanced work and was glad to listen to challenges about recruiting doctors and nurses, and dealing with insurance.

Today's year over year inflation number covers up the fact that prices keep going up and are outpacing wages. Prices increased from July to August, and Kansans know that higher prices due to Bidenomics are hurting their budgets.

Kansans deserve to know the truth about President Biden's participation in his family's business dealings with foreign entities, and an impeachment inquiry is the logical next step that will allow us to uncover the facts.

estes.house.gov/news/documen‚Ä¶

Over the weekend I enjoyed the Kansas State Fair and the annual @KSFarmBureau breakfast. Ag is such a critical part of our state's economy, and the fair is the perfect place to learn more about its impact and enjoy time with family and friends.

Happy National Aerospace Week! I got an early start to the festivities last month when I joined the @wichitaaeroclub at the Kansas Aviation Museum to discuss legislative updates impacting the aerospace industry, particularly in the Wichita region.

September 11, 2001, was a tragic day for our country, but it also showed our resolve as a nation. On this 22nd anniversary, I hope you'll join me in praying for those who lost a loved one and those who have answered the call to serve our country. We will never forget.

As a past board member, I saw firsthand how Wichita's Hunter Health Clinic cares for countless patients in our community, including those who are unable to pay. I was excited to visit recently and see plans to expand the clinic's space, so they can keep caring for patients.

Kansans are paying an average of more than $3.50 per gallon for gas. While families struggle, President Biden decided yesterday to cancel the remaining oil and gas leases issued by President Trump ‚Äì another attack on American energy that will further hurt American pocketbooks.

It was great to visit the John Bardo Center of @WichitaState's Innovation Campus with president Dr. Rick Muma and hear all of the exciting updates for the year ahead, including that this year WSU welcomed its second-largest freshmen class.

New @CBP data shows a 27% increase from June to July in illegal immigrant encounters at the southern border ‚Äì which means more deadly fentanyl in our country. Only House Republicans, with the Secure the Border Act, have taken action to address this crisis President Biden created.

Stroot Lockers, the award-winning independent meat processor, is expanding its business in Goddard. As we discussed, I'll keep working to make sure that the government, like burdensome regulations from the EPA that impact local meat processors, doesn't stand in the way of growth.

Thanks to Kerschen Farms near Garden Plain for hosting me and sharing the challenges farmers face from the devastating drought. I appreciated hearing the concerns and discussing the next Farm Bill, which helps ensure Kansas farmers can continue to feed, fuel and clothe the world.

Happy Labor Day ‚Äì thanks to the countless hardworking Kansans for all you do to keep our communities and country moving and improving. Many are enjoying this day with family and friends, but I hope you'll also join me in thanking those who are working during this holiday weekend.

It was great to visit Colwich last week with State Sen. Chase Blasi, who updated me on the lastest in the community. It was a pleasure to chat with the owner of Gambino's Pizza Original and visit with residents at Colwich Gardens Assisted Living.

It was great to see my former intern, Mr. Jay Buffum, last week at Winfield Middle School where I got to tour classrooms and meet with students. Thank you to the parents and faculty who pour so much energy into forming the next generation ‚Äì have a great school year!

Last week I joined a roundtable discussion with rural health care providers and hospitals at SCK Medical Center, which is pursuing the designation of rural emergency hospital to better serve its patients. These providers are a critical resource for our rural communities.

Yesterday's revised WOTUS rule from @EPA ignores the Supreme Court's May ruling in Sackett and continues to harm Kansas ranchers, farmers and energy producers. I will keep working to push back against this burdensome overreach by the federal government. - estes.house.gov/news/documen‚Ä¶

I joined Andy Hooser on the @toddstarnes Show to discuss the spending bills Congress will need to pass in September and the opportunity we have in the appropriations process to change the trajectory of massive government spending.
Susan and I are praying for our friend, Majority Leader Steve Scalise, as he begins treatment for Multiple Myeloma. He's a fierce fighter and we'll be standing with him.

UK Member of Parliament @pritipatel & I met earlier this month to discuss the disastrous OECD pillar 2 deal that will harm our workers & job creators, as other foreign governments seek to take over our tax codes & pilfer US & UK taxpayer money. MP Patel & I won't let it happen.
Our nation needs reliable, affordable Kansas oil and natural gas to lower gas prices and reduce energy costs.

It was great to host the Kansas Independent Oil and Gas Association, @KIOGAKansas, in Wichita last week for their annual conference where I spoke on a panel about energy policy challenges and how to advance an all-of-the-above energy strategy.
Homeownership is a significant step for many Kansans pursuing the American dream, so I was glad to meet with @SCKRealtors last week to discuss their work and the current state of the economy.
Kansans should know that fentanyl is impacting our communities and poses a dangerous, deadly threat ‚Äì just #OnePillCanKill. For helpful resources visit dea.gov/onepill.

Traveling abroad? Be sure to apply for or renew your passport ASAP as State Department processing times are delayed, 7-9 weeks for expedited service and 10-13 weeks for routine service. 

Find more resources: estes.house.gov/constituent-‚Ä¶.

Thanks to @Greater_Wichita for taking the time to update me on the biomedical campus downtown for use by WSU Tech, WSU and KU, Integra‚Äôs new facility and the new direct flight from Wichita to Washington, D.C.

Thanks to a coordinated effort from local, state and federal law enforcement agencies there are now 73,000 fewer fentanyl pills on the street in Wichita. This undoubtedly will save lives as just  #OnePillCanKill.

ksn.com/news/local/73000-fen‚Ä¶

Thank you to the generous Kansans who volunteered with @ConvoyofHope to provide more than 14,000 Kansans with school supplies and groceries for the new year, along with haircuts, health screenings, and more. Thank you for giving of your time to help others in the community.

This week I'm joining my colleagues in the Kansas delegation to raise awareness about the danger of fentanyl, which is ravaging our communities and killing young people in record numbers. 

#OnePillCanKill and families and communities deserve to know the risks and have resources.

Happy National Aviation Day! Today, Orville Wright's birthday, marks the start of National Aviation Week. As co-chair of the House Aerospace Caucus and representative of the Air Capital of the World, I'm excited to celebrate American aviation advances and the innovations to come.

It's simple. Our national debt is large and growing because we spend more than our revenue coming in. As a steering committee member of the #BipartianFiscalForum, I'm advocating for budget solutions that will help Washington curb its desire to spend money we don't have.
.@WaysandMeansGOP will keep working to execute trade deals that benefit American workers, small businesses and farmers.

Last week, the U.S.-Taiwan Initiative on 21st-Century Trade Agreement Implementation Act became law, adding Congressional support to the trade agreement and stressing Congress' privileged authority to make trade agreements.

Interested in politics or a career in public service? Come see firsthand how Congress works by interning in our nation's capital. Learn more or submit your application at estes.house.gov/constituent-‚Ä¶.

President Biden is celebrating the anniversary of the so-called Inflation Reduction Act this week, but he has it all wrong. Rather than help Americans, rampant inflation and Bidenomics have cost citizens the equivalent of two months in paychecks.

On Friday, the Wichita Dole VA is hosting a job fair with more than 85 employers. All are welcome, especially veterans who will find resources particular to their needs and experiences. 

ksn.com/news/local/dole-va-h‚Ä¶

Kansans know the beauty of our sunsets, and now a new study confirms that we have some of the best in the world. Kansas is #10 on the list of "most Instagrammable" sunsets. kansas.com/news/state/articl‚Ä¶

Don't let the headline fool you ‚Äì¬†as Kansas kids head back to school, parents are holding back on school spending because their budgets are already suffering from high prices everywhere. kwch.com/2023/08/08/parents-‚Ä¶

On National Purple Heart Day on Monday, Sedgwick Co. received the designation of a Purple Heart County. We are grateful for the men & women wounded or killed in defense of this great nation, & the designation is a way to honor & remember their sacrifices. ksn.com/news/local/sedgwick-‚Ä¶

Two headlines from yesterday that sum up Bidenomics. Out-of-control government spending and an attack on American energy production fueled massive inflation that's hurting American families, as made evident by credit card debt and 401(k) withdrawals.

Applications for U.S. service academy nominations are open now through Oct. 1. The service academies offer students a great education and the opportunity to serve the country. Learn more or apply for a nomination at estes.house.gov/service.

Last week's credit rating downgrade follows the 2011 downgrade by Standard & Poor's ‚Äì these should serve as warnings to my colleagues that we need to bring government spending under control. As it stands now, interest costs alone are more than $4,000 per year per taxpayer.

The United States has safe and secure waters because of the brave men and women who serve in the United States Coast Guard, established on this day in 1790. Thank you to past and present Coast Guardsmen of the @USCG ‚Äì Semper Paratus!

This year we're on track for the highest number of southwest border encounters on record. To secure our southern border the House passed the Secure the Border Act and will continue to investigate Sec. Mayorkas' conduct and dereliction of duty. foxnews.com/politics/house-h‚Ä¶

and Fitch's report says they expect the "deficit to rise to 6.3% of GDP in 2023, from 3.7% in 2022, reflecting cyclically weaker federal revenues, new spending initiatives and a higher interest burden." 
Out-of-control spending simply isn't sustainable. (3/3)
We urgently need to rein in this unchecked spending, which is why I'm on the steering committee of the Bipartisan Fiscal Forum. Americans know that Washington has a spending problem, (2/3)

Government spending that outpaces revenue is an entrenched problem in Washington that jeopardizes our nation, and others are taking note ‚Äì Fitch ratings downgraded the U.S. credit score from its highest rating to AA+. (1/3)
Last month, I was honored to welcome Brigadier General Michael Venerdi, the new @KansasGuard Adjutant General, to our nation's capital. Thank you for your service and leadership.

Today at 11 a.m. the Wichita Dole VA is hosting a virtual veteran town hall to introduce the new Medical Center director and share other updates. 

Join here: va.gov/wichita-health-care/e‚Ä¶ .

(4/4) With no response from Treasury, I introduced the Unfair Tax Prevention Act to impose reciprocal taxes on countries that employ the OECD global tax scheme to attack U.S. jobs and tax revenues. estes.house.gov/news/documen‚Ä¶
(3/4) and again in a July op-ed with @RepFeenstra: Biden Should Use OECD Tax Talks to Help, Not Harm, US Interests, news.bloombergtax.com/tax-in‚Ä¶.
(2/4) I raised my concerns about the harmful effects of this deal in a March op-ed: Yellen is giving away the farm through global tax scheme, thehill.com/opinion/congress‚Ä¶

In a March hearing, @SecYellen refused to provide info on the economic impact of the OECD tax scheme‚Äìwhich Treasury has no authority to commit to‚Äìand she still hasn't. I led a letter w/ @RepCarolMiller and @WaysandMeansGOP colleagues expressing our concerns and imploring answers.

Tomorrow, the Wichita Dole VA will host a virtual veterans town hall. Tune in to meet the new Medical Center director, hear the latest on the construction project and more. The town hall is virtual only, due to construction. 

Join here: va.gov/wichita-health-care/e‚Ä¶.
Last week's @WaysandMeansGOP markup was an important step toward improving the prior authorization process ‚Äì these changes will save money and improve the delivery and quality of care for patients.

It was great to welcome Miss Kansas to our nation's capital and learn about her work connecting blind and visually impaired Kansans to employement opportunities. Thank you for your work and for representing the Sunflower State!

As key partners, Israel and the U.S. work together to advance agriculture through the U.S.-Israel Binational Agricultural Research and Development Fund (BARD) @BDevelopm, offering scientists opportunities to pursue agricultural research relevant to many Kansans.

With bipartisan support, the House passed a Congressional Review Act to delist the lesser prairie-chicken as an endangered species ‚Äì as I said on the floor, the LPC is stable thanks to efforts from Kansans and other rural Americans.

Learn more in my @westerncaucus op-ed,
westerncaucus.house.gov/news‚Ä¶

Today the House votes on a Congressional Review Act to overrule Fish and Wildlife Service's classification of the lesser prairie-chicken as endangered ‚Äì the LPC population is stable thanks to local efforts, and rural Americans don't need more government overregulation.

The Sound of Freedom tells a powerful story and shines light on a terrible evil taking place in our country and world. I‚Äôm glad I had the chance to see the film with my colleagues, as we keep working on solutions to combat child trafficking.

In support of his work as Chair of the House Armed Services Tactical Air and Land Forces Subcommittee, Rep. @RobWittman spent the day in Wichita ‚Äì it was great to show him the innovation taking place in the Air Capital of the World that is moving defense and aerospace forward.

At last week's @WaysandMeansGOP tax subcommittee hearing it was made clear ‚Äì provisions in the OECD's new global tax deal, like the Under Taxed Profit Rule, are punitive and anti-American and the reason why I introduced the Unfair Tax Prevention Act with @RepJasonSmith.

With @ITI_TechTweets, @RepJohnLarson and I discussed how the American Innovation and R&D Competitiveness Act is a jobs-boosting bill ‚Äì every $1 billion in R&D investment leads to and supports 17,000 jobs earning $1.4 billion in salary.

Last week I received the Award for Conservative Excellence from @CPAC and the Center for Legislative Accountability ‚Äì I'll keep working hard to deliver for the 4th District of Kansas and to uphold our nation's constitutional and founding principles.

Heartland Welding is helping meet the demand for skilled workers in our region by training both students who are new to the workforce and those making a career switch ‚Äì it was a privilege to meet some these talented individuals on a recent visit.

Today would have been Sen. Bob Dole's 100th birthday. One of Kansas' favorite sons, he served our nation in battle and in Congress, and was an inspiration to many. His life embodied our Kansas values, and he is greatly missed.
From a small trading post on the Chisholm Trail to the Air Capital of the World, happy 153rd birthday, Wichita!

The crisis at our southern border has made every city a border city, so the House passed the Schools Not Shelters Act this week to make sure that schools are used to educate children, not house any of the tens of thousands of people who've illegally entered our country.

As chair of the House Aerospace Caucus I'm glad the House passed legislation reauthorizing the Federal Aviation Administration ‚Äì bolstering our nation's critical aviation workforce and furthering our position as a leader in aerospace safety and innovation. estes.house.gov/aerospace/ne‚Ä¶

.@HooserReason and I discussed the IRS whistleblowers who exposed the mishandling of the investigation into Hunter Biden and his corruption ‚Äì  thanks to their testimony at @GOPoversight we know more about what went wrong, which @WaysandMeansGOP will continue to investigate.

It was an honor to hear from Israeli president @Isaac_Herzog and recognize the longstanding friendship that exists between the U.S. and Israel ‚Äì a key democratic ally in a region crowded with autocrats. The United States will continue to stand with and defend Israel.

.@WaysandMeansGOP chair @RepJasonSmith & I introduced legislation countering taxes in the OECD's global tax scheme that attack U.S. jobs and tax revenues. If countries proceed with the flawed Under Taxed Profits Rule surtax they will face steep penalties. estes.house.gov/news/documen‚Ä¶

Kicking a bad rule down the road and creating more uncertainty for U.S. companies is not a win ‚Äì the Undertaxed Profit Rule would have a disproportionately negative effect on the U.S. and I will continue to work to push back against this rule.

wsj.com/articles/u-s-compani‚Ä¶
On my recent visit to The Heritage in Andover I was excited to see how this new mixed-use space will bring more economic activity to the area north of Kellogg and east of Andover Road.

Glad to see some of my Democrat colleagues push back against the vitriolic, antisemitic comments from members of their caucus ‚Äì Israel is a key and longstanding ally of the United States, and I look forward to welcoming @Isaac_Herzog to our nation's capitol on Wednesday.

Last week I visited the @midkscoop farm co-op at their new Wichita office to discuss the upcoming farm bill and key trade issues for the agricultural community ‚Äì a cornerstone of our economy and so many Kansas communities.

The National Defense Authorization Act we passed in the House today provides a critical boost to our national security and our men and women in uniform, while curbing wasteful spending and rooting out Biden‚Äôs radical political agenda.
estes.house.gov/news/documen‚Ä¶

The OECD is negotiating and promoting tax deals that have a disproportionately negative effect on the United States. Congressional appropriators are joining @WaysandMeansGOP in pushing back against the OECD's bad deal ‚Äì stay tuned as we do more to defend our tax code.

Our historically high debt burden is cause for concern and cause for action ‚Äì the newly launched #BipartisanFiscalForum will offer budget reforms to ensure the long-term financial stability of our nation and I'm excited to serve on the steering committee. 
estes.house.gov/news/documen‚Ä¶

Firefighters take extraordinary risks to save lives and protect our communities. The new fire station under construction in Andover will give these brave men and women the opportunities they need for advanced training to be ready for any emergency.

CPI numbers show the year-over-year inflation rate has slowed to 3% but Kansans are still paying 15.7% more for the same goods and services than they were in Jan. 2021 when Biden took office. This change isn't a #Bidenomics win since it's only slowing a Bidenomics-caused problem.

.@ButlerCC's new Redler Institute of Culinary Arts is cooking up success. On a recent visit with the Andover Area Chamber of Commerce I learned how the Institute is giving students the hands-on training they need to launch their careers in the culinary and restaurant industry.

Last week I met with @KIOGAKansas president Ed Cross to discuss the latest in the oil and gas industry and ways to support Kansas energy producers ‚Äì a critical sector of our economy and a crucial tool in regaining American energy independence.

On @FRCdc we discussed how the Chinese unfairly tilt the playing field in their favor ‚Äì while the Biden administration stands by and watches. Instead, my American Innovation and R&D Competitiveness Act takes action to boost R&D at home so we can depend on China less.

Only 13% of Americans have outstanding student debt. As I discussed with Andy Hooser on the @toddstarnes Show, those who worked through college or pursued a different path shouldn't be forced to take that on.

#Bidenomics is not something to brag about ‚Äì real wages are down more than 5% and the average worker lost more than $4,900 in real wages due to Bidenflation. Read more about the president's dismal economic record in my @DerbyInformer op-ed.
derbyinformer.com/news/opini‚Ä¶

The Biden administration, ignoring American interests, has been led by OECD bureaucrats into a terrible deal that uniquely harms U.S. businesses. @RepFeenstra and I expose the details of this bad deal and how @WaysandMeansGOP Republicans are pushing back.

news.bloomberglaw.com/busine‚Ä¶

When it comes to the economy and inflation the Biden administration is not telling the whole truth ‚Äì I joined @HooserReason on the @toddstarnes show to explain how they cherry-pick numbers and offer misleading data and how Congress can help rein in spending.
(17/17) We can‚Äôt afford more of Biden and congressional Democrats‚Äô failed ‚ÄúBidenomics‚Äù economic policies.

(16/17) The facts all point to the same conclusion ‚Äì #Bidenomics is a failure, and that‚Äôs why Americans don‚Äôt trust Biden. He can say what he wants, but Americans trust their own experience paying more and more for the same goods and services.
(15/17) If you take a look at the chart, gas prices are still up from when Biden took office and have only declined from the peak caused by Putin‚Äôs market disrupting invasion of Ukraine.

(14/17) And as we‚Äôre constantly reminded, gas prices are 34% higher than when Biden took office. The president pushed the blame on everyone, instead of his policies attacking American energy production.

(13/17) Bidenomics prioritizes the wealthy and our adversaries and has left families worse off in terms of real household net worth. Since Biden took office, real wages are down more than 5% and the average worker has lost over $4,900 in real wages.

(12/17) Contrast this with Biden‚Äôs so-called Inflation Reduction Act with billions of dollars in ‚Äúgreen‚Äù tax credits that benefit the top 1%, costing Americans an estimated $1.2 trillion, while also providing the Chinese with green subsidies to the detriment of American workers.

(11/17) Biden doubling down on this reckless spending has set us on an unsustainable path. The Congressional Budget Office now projects that in 30 years US debt will grow to $144 trillion, or $1 million per household ‚Äì more than four times median household net worth ($122,000).

(10/17) Had Biden pursued common sense policies, instead of Bidenomics, and kept 2022 spending near CBO‚Äôs projections, the budget deficit would have been its lowest since 2001 ‚Äì the last time the government ran a surplus.

(9/17) And in spite of his claim that Bidenomics policies have reduced the deficit by more than $1 trillion, Biden‚Äôs spending deficit in 2022 was $1.38T while, prior to COVID, only President Obama had a deficit of more than $1T.

(8/17) Biden also likes to pretend that his budget cuts the deficit by $3 trillion, but only in Washington does this math make any sense. His budget proposal actually increases the deficit by $17 trillion over 10 years, but since it‚Äôs not $20 trillion, that‚Äôs a $3 trillion ‚Äúcut.‚Äù

(7/17) This means people still aren‚Äôt working. Adjusting for population gains, nearly 2 million more Americans are on the sidelines today ‚Äì under Biden, the labor force participation rate remains 0.7 percentage points lower than when President Trump was in office.
(6/17) More than 70% of the jobs Biden "created" were simply jobs recovered after the pandemic. The trendline of job creation under Trump is still higher.

(5/17) The president also likes to say that he's created more jobs than any other president. Also misleading. We all know that government-mandated COVID shutdowns destroyed jobs. Prior to that, job creation was surging under President Trump.

(4/17) And the president likes to say inflation is down ~50% since last summer, but that's misleading. It's not prices that are down 50%, but the annual inflation rate that is now about half of what it was when it peaked at 9% under this president's misguided Bidenomics policies.

(3/17) You might hear that inflation is up 4% ‚Äì that's true, prices are up 4% over the last year, when prices were already steeply increasing. And that‚Äôs on top of the nearly 9% increase the year before that.

(2/17) Bidenflation is the biggest failure of Bidenomics. Prices for the same goods and services are up 15.5% since Biden took office ‚Äì far more than inflation at the same point under his predecessors.

üßµ Biden is trying to coin the phrase ‚ÄúBidenomics‚Äù in an attempt to prop up his record on the economy. 

But Americans know the truth ‚Äì #Bidenomics is a dismal failure. Nearly 70% of Americans say the economy is fair or poor, with just 31% saying it's excellent or good. (1/17)
Happy Independence Day! üá∫üá∏

On @NEWSMAX I explained how I worked with colleagues on @WaysandMeansGOP to make the allegations about Hunter Biden public ‚Äì we'll continue to work to ensure the legislative branch can conduct proper oversight of the executive branch and root out Biden corruption from the swamp.

Biden ignored the Constitution and Congress' bill undoing his student debt transfer scheme. The Supreme Court's ruling checks his runaway use of executive power that would have benefited the wealthy at the expense of those who worked through college or pursued another path.

This month I've thanked law enforcement officers in Harvey County and spoke at the Kansas Fraternal Order of Police's state conference in Wichita. Officers are on the frontlines of our communities, keeping us safe and serving neighbors. I'm grateful for the men and women in blue.
This bold claim from President Biden misinterprets the data. More than 70% of job gains under Biden are simply the recovery of jobs lost due to government-mandated COVID lockdowns.

Using an old KC-135, a new @WichitaState partnership will research and develop innovations to reduce the operations costs of legacy aircraft. This will help extend the lifespan of a legacy aircraft, modernize systems and improve operations and maintenance.
